12sts cut yarn leaving a tail end to sew the seam with thread end through all 12 sts pull up to gather tightly and secure the end for the stem base sew the seam lightly stuffing as you go joining the stem row ends with mattress stitch from the fastened-off stem base to just before the top of the stem - see fig 1 attend to the light the very first thing to do is to take out the white stopper that which switches the light off/ on from the balloon light and very carefully make a hole in the centre of the widest round bit the narrower part of the stopper is the part that you ll insert fig 3 fig 4 into the light - see fig 2 when you ve done that take a sewing needle with a large eye for threading up yarn and one that will pass easily through the hole you ve just made in the stopper thread the yarn tail end from the stem cast-on edge into the sewing needle and pass the threaded-up needle into the hole in the stopper - see fig 3 now work stitches in and around the stopper hole at the same time completing the seam from the stem - see fig 4 as soon as you ve joined the bottom half of the stopper to the mushroom stem insert the other half of the stopper back into the balloon light to save the energy they do last a very long time so don t worry no need to rush the above fig 5 fig 6 mushroom lantern page 6 mushroom lantern page 7 cap underside join the cap underside to the stem beginning at the edge of the cap with yarn b cast on 54 sts place the 18 sts through which you ve passed a sewing needle against the top of the row 1 *p1 k2** repeat from * to ** across to the end of the row stem gather up the 18 sts around the top of the stem and carefully sew the gathered- row 2 *p2 k1** repeat from * to ** across to the end of the
